title: ICE: index out of bounds: the len is 323 but the index is 324, ena-0.14.0/src/snapshot_vec.rs:199:10

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
### Code This was in a closed source codebase I don't have time to minimize right now. It happened when I called `.unwrap_or_else()` (or something like that, don't exactly remember) on a value with type `impl Future>`. Don't remember what T or E were :( ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.64.0-nightly (2643b1646 2022-07-27) ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 323 but the index is 324', /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/ena-0.14.0/src/snapshot_vec.rs:199:10 ```
Backtrace
